page.title: 19Quixhill Shire Horses
page.content: The Croft, a farm of 45 acres is where Jim Salt breeds his shire horses. They are huge horses once used to pull ploughs but are now used for showing, pulling dreys, wagons for advertising. He has 6 stallions and 2 mares of whom Cubley Charlie is a great champion. He weighs 1 ton 2 cwts. and is l8 hands tall. He eats 4 buckets of bran and corn and a bale of hay each day. He is such an exceptional horse that many breeders send their mares for him to sire their foals. The Quixhill name is his own and very famous. 42 mares come to the 6 stallions each year and stay for 2\3 weeks. The pregnancy lasts ll months. The foals weigh 2 cwt. when they are born. After 5 days the stallion is put to the mare again so she can produce a foal the next year. They can be sold for a great deal of money and many are exported.
